text: following last week's attacks in Mumbai
in which now more than 180 people appear
to have been killed on Monday the story
shifted toward tensions between India
and Pakistan as the Indian government
summoned the Pakistani ambassador and
said that it was Pakistani citizens and
militant groups based in Pakistan that
carried out the attacks he was informed
that the recent terrorist attack on
Mumbai was carried out by elements from
Pakistan government expected that strong
action would be taken against those
elements whosoever they may be fingers
are pointing right now at a group called
lashkar-e-toiba it's a group that's been
around for for quite a while whose
primary gribbins grievance is the
situation in Kashmir which is divided
between India and Pakistan they have
more flow over the last few years to to
develop more international networks and
a broader contact with possibly al Qaeda
and other militant groups in Pakistan's
tribal areas this kind of attack might
be an effort to redirect the efforts of
the Pakistani military more toward India
and create tensions between India and
Pakistan doing so it would possibly
shift resources away from the fighting
that's been going on up in Pakistan's
tribal areas where the Pakistani
military has been engaged in heavy
battles with these kinds of militant
groups up there along the Afghan border
we will be working with India we intend
to work with Pakistan as well the people
who perpetrated this must be brought to
justice and ultimately the terrorists
have to have to be stopped by mid-week
Secretary Rice will go to the region in
hopes of easing tensions between the two
countries for the United States
certainly they don't want any Pakistani
forces moved off of that border with
Afghanistan where they've been fighting
these militants and over toward India
the United States would really like
if anything the pack of the packaging is
to be able to move more forces from the
Indian border and up toward the tribal
areas to help fight these militant
groups who use northern Pakistan as a
base to launch attacks on American
forces in Afghanistan but what the
Pakistani government can do at this
point is not very clear these groups
have become embedded up in the tribal
areas where the Pakistanis are fighting
very heavily on on a military front
they're not making a lot of traction at
this point
